billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO VETERANS, HOMELAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS

title: Directs the adjutant general to present a United States flag to the person disposing of the body of a member of the organized militia
summary: Directs the adjutant general, upon request, to present a United States flag to the person designated to dispose of the body of a member of the organized militia, when such member served his or her initial obligation, was discharged for disability incurred or aggravated in the line of duty, or whose service up to the date of death was honorable.
currentCommittee: VETERANS, HOMELAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1431

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                    January 7, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by Sens. SALAND, BONACIC, DeFRANCISCO, LARKIN, RANZENHOFER --
         read  twice  and  ordered printed, and when printed to be committed to
         the Committee on Veterans, Homeland Security and Military Affairs

       AN ACT to amend the military law, in relation to the presentation  of  a
         flag  of  the United States to the person designated to dispose of the
         remains of certain members of the organized militia

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. The opening paragraph of subdivision 1 of section 250-a of
    2  the military law is designated paragraph a and  a  new  paragraph  b  is
    3  added to read as follows:
    4    B. THE ADJUTANT GENERAL UPON REQUEST, SHALL AUTHORIZE THE PRESENTATION
    5  OF  A  FLAG OF THE UNITED STATES, WHERE SUCH FLAG IS NOT PROVIDED BY THE
    6  UNITED STATES, TO THE PERSON DESIGNATED TO DISPOSE OF THE REMAINS  OF  A
    7  MEMBER OF THE ORGANIZED MILITIA, AS DEFINED IN ARTICLE TWO OF THIS CHAP-
    8  TER,  WHO  HAS  SERVED  HIS OR HER INITIAL OBLIGATION, OR WAS DISCHARGED
    9  THEREFROM FOR A DISABILITY INCURRED OR AGGRAVATED IN THE LINE  OF  DUTY,
   10  OR WHOSE SERVICE UP TO THE DATE OF DEATH WAS HONORABLE.
   11    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03598-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the military law, in relation to the presentation of a flag of the United States to the person designated to dispose of the remains of certain members of the organized militia
